item.title: Bolna nabs $6.3M from General Catalyst for its India-focused voice orchestration platform
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Bolna said that 75% of its revenue is coming from self-serve customers.

item.title: Anthropic’s CEO stuns Davos with Nvidia criticism
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei unloaded on both the administration and U.S. chip companies over plans to sell to China. The criticism was particularly notable because one of those chipmakers, Nvidia, is a major partner and investor in Anthropic.

item.title: In an effort to protect young users, ChatGPT will now predict how old you are
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The feature is designed to stop problematic content from being delivered to users under the age of 18.

item.title: Elon Musk says Tesla’s restarted Dojo3 will be for ‘space-based AI compute’
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Tesla aims to restart work on Dojo3, its previously abandoned third-generation AI chip. Only this time, Dojo3 won’t be aimed at training self-driving models on Earth. Instead, Musk says it will be dedicated to “space-based AI compute.”

item.title: Humans&, a ‘human-centric’ AI startup founded by Anthropic, xAI, Google alums, raised $480M seed round
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Humans&, a startup that believes AI should empower people, not replace them, has reportedly raised a $480 million seed round at a $4.48 billion valuation.

item.title: Indian vibe-coding startup Emergent triples valuation to $300M with $70M fundraise
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The funding comes as the startup claims it has scaled ARR to $50 million and is targeting $100 million by April 2026.

item.title: Here are the 55 US AI startups that raised $100M or more in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Last year was monumental for the AI industry in the U.S. and beyond. How will 2025 compare?

item.title: Well, there goes the metaverse!
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The metaverse is on its last legs as VR is eclipsed by AI. But that's not the only thing that went wrong for Meta's VR ambitions.

item.title: Rogue agents and shadow AI: Why VCs are betting big on AI security
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Misaligned agents are just one layer of the AI security challenge that startup Witness AI is trying to solve. It detects employee use of unapproved tools, blocks attacks, and ensures compliance.

item.title: Sequoia to invest in Anthropic, breaking VC taboo on backing rivals: FT
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Venture capital firms have historically avoided backing competing companies in the same sector, preferring to place their bets on a single winner. Yet here's Sequoia, already invested in both OpenAI and Elon Musk's xAI, now throwing its weight behind Anthropic, too.

item.title: Moxie Marlinspike has a privacy-conscious alternative to ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: Confer is designed to look and feel like ChatGPT or Claude, but your conversations can't be used for training or advertising.

item.title: Musk wants up to $134B in OpenAI lawsuit, despite $700B fortune
item.dc:creator: Connie Loizos
item.description: Musk's legal team argues he should be compensated as an early startup investor who sees returns "many orders of magnitude greater" than his initial investment.

item.title: AI cloud startup Runpod hits $120M in ARR — and it started with a Reddit post
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Their startup journey is a wild example of how if you build it well and the timing is lucky, they will definitely come.

item.title: California AG sends Musk’s xAI a cease-and-desist order over sexual deepfakes
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The flood of AI-generated sexual imagery has spurred concern from state and congressional officials alike.

item.title: From OpenAI’s offices to a deal with Eli Lilly — how Chai Discovery became one of the flashiest names in AI drug development
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The startup has partnered with Eli Lilly and enjoys the backing of some of Silicon Valley's most influential VCs.

item.title: ChatGPT users are about to get hit with targeted ads
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: OpenAI says that users impacted by the ads will have some control over what they see.

item.title: Trump administration wants tech companies to buy $15B of power plants they may not use
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: In an attempt to alleviate rising electricity prices, the White House wants grid operator PJM to hold an auction for new generating capacity, and it wants tech companies to bid.

item.title: The AI healthcare gold rush is here
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: AI companies are clustering around healthcare and fast.  In just the past week, OpenAI bought health startup Torch, Anthropic launched Claude for healthcare, and Sam Altman-backed MergeLabs closed a $250 million seed round at an $850 million valuation. The money and products are pouring into health and voice AI, but so are concerns about hallucination risks, inaccurate medical information, and […]

item.title: OpenAI and Anthropic are making their play for healthcare, and we’re not surprised
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha, Sean O'Kane
item.description: AI companies are clustering around healthcare, and fast. In just the past week, OpenAI bought health startup Torch, Anthropic launched Claude for Health, and Sam Altman-backed Merge Labs closed a $250 million seed round at an $850 million valuation. The money and products are pouring into health and voice AI, but so are concerns about […]

item.title: The rise of ‘micro’ apps: non-developers are writing apps instead of buying them
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: A new era of app creation is here. It's fun, it's fast, and it's fleeting.
